ygData.subject: Hmm... Manners
ygData.msgSnippet: That s my biggest gripe about EQ so far. I don t really care so much that Verant nerfs things unnecessarily, touting that they gave players too much of an
ygData.messageBody:
That's my biggest gripe about EQ so far. I don't
really care so much that Verant nerfs things
unnecessarily, touting that they gave players too much of an
advantage, as if they don't need it against NPCs that punch
for ungodly amounts, have infinite mana pools, can
cast 200+ dd spells in half a sec without being
interrupted by constant hits and movements... well, you get
the idea.<br>I don't really care so much about the
ridiculous prices people want to demand for items that are
high level and only used to twink with. Things that
aren't necessary to develop a character as there are 60s
out there that have never had such items in their
young lives on through middle age.<br>No... my problem
that drives me from EQ mostly is the manners problem.
So many rude people, so many "bastards" out there.
They think "Well, I can do whatever I want, it's just
a game, screw them if they don't like how I
behave." It's stupid. I mean, most of these people don't
understand that just because you pay to play doesn't mean
you must be an ass to others. *forgive my language,
but I feel strongly about this*<br>I don't pay my
monthly fee to play just to come on and watch people
scream at each other over OOC, beg me for things in
tells, hail me repeatedly and inspect me without asking
*especially if I'm fighting a mob!*, and get mad when I don't
sow them immediately when I'm out of mana. People in
EQ... well, actually, people in the real world as well,
all need to remember what the things called manners
are. There is a total lack of respect for each other
running rampant in the world and it's all because of my
generation that grew up spoiled brats because of previous
generations giving us everything and reading things like Dr.
Spock and taking good advice overboard. C'mon people...
just because everything has been given to a lot of us
doesn't mean we need to treat everyone around us like
total jerks because we're cocky about everything.<br>Do
I refuse to help someone that's been an ass to me?
No... I still help them out if I can. They don't walk
on me, I just refuse to be on their level and be a
jerk because I was given a bad turn. I still sow the
angry bastard. I still heal those that are dying,
whether they've been annoying or not. If they're mature
individuals, they'll realize it was given freely and not
because they bitched and whined, but because a good
person was behind that pixel on their screen.<br>And
maybe eventually they'll get it through their head that
not everyone is a jerk like them and they'll start
doing others good turns.<br>It's stupid to think that,
I know... but hey... at least it makes me special
and different from everyone else. It doesn't mean I
have to talk to them. It doesn't mean I have to cater
to them. I give them the whatever anyway (being a
35th level shaman, you can give a lot), and then just
be on my way and forget they exist. Odds are, with
how much I move around, I'll never see them again
anyway.<br><br>But the fact remains... I'm sick of the assholes. I
come on EQ to get away from people like that. And then
I run into more there? That's no fun. I usually
have OOC and Shout turned off... Auction is
perpetually off due to being sickened by prices in
general.<br><br>-Kalranis Darkholme<br>18th Cleric, Brell Serilis
Server<br>-Kahunaman Lahiki<br>35th Shaman, Brell Serilis Server
